newsitem.title: USA: American Airlines pilots say to make new proposal.
newsitem.headline: American Airlines pilots say to make new proposal.

text.p: Pilots of AMR Corp.'s American Airlines will make a comprehensive proposal later Thursday to try to end a dispute with the company and head off a strike, a union leader said.

"This afternoon we will make a complete proposal on competitive costs, either face to face or through the mediator," Allied Pilots Association President James Sovich told a news conference. The airline has said the pilots' pay and other demands would make it uncompetitive.
Sovich said that although talks this week through a mediator had been "incredibly difficult and not very fruitful," he believed a solution was possible.
"There is a constructive solution to this problem. We believe our two sides should sit down together and bargain over competitive costs," he said.

He said the union's board would vote Friday on whether to authorise a strike that same night, adding "I believe the board will vote to authorise the strike." He also said that President Clinton should not step in to avert the strike.

Clinton is "seriously considering" becoming involved in the dispute, Representative Martin Frost, D-Texas, said, adding he had spoken to administration representatives at the "high level" who have told him that Clinton is monitoring the dispute carefully.
